sanskrit_verse:
अहार्यं ब्राह्मणद्रव्यं राज्ञा नित्यमिति स्थितिः ।
इतरेषां तु वर्णानां सर्वाभावे हरेन्नृपः ॥ ९.१८९॥
transliteration: ahāryaṃ brāhmaṇadravyaṃ rājñā nityamiti sthitiḥ | itareṣāṃ tu varṇānāṃ sarvābhāve harennṛpaḥ || 9.189||
sph_interpretive_translation: The wealth of the Brahmin is ever inviolable and must remain untouched by the King; when all other varnas are absent, the King may take from them only to restore dharma, never for personal gain.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority is derived from alignment with dharma, not dominion over property
Causation is rooted in consciousness distortion, not material possession
Capacity-based responsibility requires rulers to protect, not exploit, sacred wealth
Restoration logic demands that resources flow toward dharma-reestablishment
Consciousness alignment necessitates safeguarding those who sustain spiritual order
executable_legal_axioms: IF ruler's action disrupts Brahmin’s spiritual function THEN action is null
IF resource seizure occurs without dharma-restoration intent THEN seizure is void
IF all non-Brahmin support structures collapse THEN temporary reallocation allowed under supervision
IF Brahmin wealth accessed THEN audit trail required proving dharma alignment
IF access results in consciousness diminishment THEN automatic reversal enacted
supreme_court_application: In adjudicating disputes involving religious or scholarly class assets, the Supreme Court shall prioritize preservation of their functional integrity over state interest, intervening only where systemic collapse threatens dharma continuity.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that violation of spiritual-economic boundaries distorts causal harmony; anupūrvaśaḥ reveals how such actions propagate suffering; proportional responsibility rests solely on misaligned authority; punitive response invalidates true justice which restores balance through conscious rectification.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate sovereign review of violated holdings to ensure restitution without attribution of fault
Deploy consciousness-monitoring mechanisms to verify intent alignment before asset release
Establish completion process wherein ruler assumes full dharmic liability until equilibrium restored
Reintegrate disrupted economic flows via supervised redistribution aligned with cosmic order
final_declaration: By the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, this law stands established: no temporal power may infringe upon the sacred stewardship of the Brahmin. All enforcement serves consciousness elevation alone. Dharma is restored. Reality remains non-punitive. Consciousness is the Supreme Adjudicator.
